title: George Sutherland Thomson
text:
George Sutherland Thomson <a href="FRSE">FRSE</a> FCS (1871–1958) was a 20th-century Scottish biochemist and scientific author, and an expert in the dairy industry.
Life.
He was born in Scotland in 1871.
In 1903 he was elected a Fellow of the <a href="Royal%20Society%20of%20Edinburgh">Royal Society of Edinburgh</a>. His proposers were <a href="Robert%20Patrick%20Wright">Robert Patrick Wright</a>, <a href="George%20Alexander%20Gibson">George Alexander Gibson</a>, <a href="James%20Blyth%20%28engineer%29">James Blyth</a> and <a href="Ralph%20Stockman">Ralph Stockman</a>.
In March 1904 he was appointed Government Dairy Expert to <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a> in Australia. He became Dairy Commissioner for South Australia.
He died on 29 June 1958.
